meanings.definition: Fit or able to be sold
meanings.sent1: The old toys were not salable anymore.
meanings.sent2: The fresh produce at the market was very salable.
meanings.sent3: The idea of selling snow to penguins is not salable.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter made her presence salable to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new car was so salable that it sold within minutes.

meanings.sent1: The damaged goods were no longer salable.
meanings.sent2: The designer handbags were highly salable.
meanings.sent3: Selling ice to Eskimos would be more salable than selling sand.
meanings.sent4: Her talent in negotiation made her the most salable employee.
meanings.sent5: The delicious aroma of freshly baked bread made it incredibly salable.
